unit.utterance: Ore ipiatlak natopu nigmam ni esa. Naat kipe gaag trausi?
unit.utterance_translation: Yes, we have a natopu. Has anyone talked to you about it?

unit.utterance: [AUDIENCE] Sees m̃as.
unit.utterance_translation: [AUDIENCE] Only a little.

unit.utterance: Nigmam natopu nigmam ni esa, ga kin ito, ito ito pan, ito teetwei paakor mees.
unit.utterance_translation: Our natopu, the natopu from this place, he is the one who is there, who has been there from long ago until today.

unit.utterance: Me ito, mal ni tiawi ni teetwei, malen natopu nigmam ito.
unit.utterance_translation: He was there at the time of our ancestors. When our spirit he was here

unit.utterance: Go iptal, iptal nmatu. Iptal teesa nmatu, na ruktua teesa nmatu keskei.
unit.utterance_translation: He would ask for a woman or a girl, he would ask that they give him a girl.

unit.utterance: Go rupo tua teesa nmatu iskei. Malnen imur na teesa nmatu ne,
unit.utterance_translation: And they would give him a girl. Once he wanted this girl,

unit.utterance: teesa nmatu ne nagien ipi Litog.
unit.utterance_translation: her name was Litog.

unit.utterance: Me imur teesa nmatu ne go ito tp̃olu na,
unit.utterance_translation: He wanted this girl and he would send a message, saying (so that?)

unit.utterance: tenen rusel nafsan ga, ki taosi kin, [...] itp̃olu polis ga.
unit.utterance_translation: that they (his police) take his message. A natopu has assistants to do its work and they are called its

unit.utterance: Olsem hemi sendem polis blong hem, a? Itp̃olu polis ga, olsem, ol smol smol samting we oli stap long sol wota, a?
unit.utterance_translation: [code switch to Bislama] So he sent his police. He sent them with a message, all the small creatures that live in

unit.utterance: Ipiatlak, na, pislama, kufa.
unit.utterance_translation: There was bêche-de-mer, shellfish.

unit.utterance: [AUDIENCE] litot.
unit.utterance_translation: [AUDIENCE] Shellfish.

unit.utterance: Aa.
unit.utterance_translation: Ah.

unit.utterance: Malen tiawi rulemsi rutae, na polis rupa raru teesa nmatu ne rumai ruler pa.
unit.utterance_translation: When the ancestors saw it they knew they were the police. They took the girl in the canoe, they came and they returned.

unit.utterance: Tete nrak tam̃ra, rumai tiawi rutae.
unit.utterance_translation: Some times starfish come and the old people know.

unit.utterance: Rupi polis ga, rupa reki nmatu. Ipregi panpanpan naliati iskei.
unit.utterance_translation: They are its police, they go to get a woman. Until, one day,

unit.utterance: go runa, "Tukga kraksoksok me tukfan psi." Go rupo pan ga psi im̃ol.
unit.utterance_translation: they said, "We will prepare things for her and we will put them there.' And they put her there alive.

unit.utterance: Malen kin ruga pregptaki m̃it, ruga pregptaki nkal, panpan inom rutatweki raru, rumsagi raru me rupa.
unit.utterance_translation: Then they prepared mats for her. They prepared cloth for her, and when they were done they put them in a canoe and took them to it (Litong)

unit.utterance: Nlaken esum̃ ga, ipato elag esanpe. Ruga msag serale nen plake pa me rupan me ga kipe pi nskau p̃ur iskei a?
unit.utterance_translation: Because her house was up there somewhere. They took her all this stuff but the natopu's house was the big reef.

unit.utterance: Ipaakor to, ito elag nam̃oru. Rupa rupam̃or nskau nen ito rutae na rukfo psi esa.
unit.utterance_translation: She had appeared, there out in the deep sea. They went and found the reef and they knew that they would put their presents there.

unit.utterance: Go rukoi psi, ruga sat serale pan psi panpan inom, ale rulaoki.
unit.utterance_translation: And they put it there, they took her everything until there was no more, they stood it up there.

unit.utterance: Puet nmatu, Litog, rupsi ilao skot serale tu, me rukoipak em̃ae.
unit.utterance_translation: They took a woman, Litog, they put her there, she was standing with all the things, but they went away.

unit.utterance: Malen rupak em̃ae itaos nao iskei, a?
unit.utterance_translation: When they went away it was like a wave came up, do you see?

unit.utterance: imai mai mai mai, p̃aakor faat ne. Inom. Iplake im̃ol pa.
unit.utterance_translation: It came and came, over that rock. Finished. It took her, alive, and went.

unit.utterance: Go iplake im̃ol to, go im̃ol to tup̃̃ mees.
unit.utterance_translation: It took her alive and she is alive to this day.

unit.utterance: Ito paakor tup̃ mees.
unit.utterance_translation: She keeps appearing today.

unit.utterance: [AUDIENCE] Litog.
unit.utterance_translation: [AUDIENCE] Litog.

unit.utterance: Litog. Nlaken ipi nmatu ga, ilakor pi, kefo to panpanpan emermen kefo plake puel, tefla.
unit.utterance_translation: Litog. Because it is his wife, she will disappear with the world.

unit.utterance: Natopu nigmam ni esa, rutua nmatu, me rutua kin im̃ol.
unit.utterance_translation: They gave the natopu a woman, they gave him a live woman.

unit.utterance: Go ga kin ito, ito tup̃ mees. Ale itefla.
unit.utterance_translation: And he is still there, until today. It's like that.

unit.utterance: Taos ni natopu nigmam ni esa, ratua malen imur nmatu, rutua kin im̃ol
unit.utterance_translation: Like our natopu from here, they gave him the woman, when he wants a woman they give her to him, alive.
